chargeHist.descr: Delivery of Schedule I, II Narcotics

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Heyde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery of Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
Pay any remaining court costs/financial obligations.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Huber has been granted. Stayed pending further order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Delivery of Schedule I, II Narcotics
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Heyde

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.

Adding Probation Condition: "No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting;" 
and the following language:
"If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt."
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Cases called at 4:01 PM: 20CF1163, 21CF396, 21CF579, 22CF156.
Defendant Daniel J. Heyde in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald K Colwell (20CF1163) and Attorney Katherine Cook (21CF396, 21CF579, 22CF156) . 
District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CF396, 21CF579, 22CF156: Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
21CF579: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver Heroin (<=3g); 2nd or Subsequent Offense; Repeater and Count 4: Obstructing an Officer; Repeater.
22CF156: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Delivery of Schedule I, II Narcotics; Repeater, 2nd or Subsequent Offense.
Defendant makes a statement to the Court.

3 Years of Initial Confinement and 3 Years of Extended Supervision is Imposed and Stayed and the Defendant is placed on 48 Months of Probation (on the felonies only) with the following conditions:
180 Days of Jail with Huber (stayed pending further order of the Court), Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.  Court Costs/surcharges including $50 Buy Money, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Court finds the Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP if DOC determines that he is statutorily eligible.

21CF579: Count 4: Defendant is sentenced to 9 Months of Jail with Huber (Concurrent to 20CF1163) and is granted 72 days credit.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

20CF1163: (Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine; Repeater): Defendant is sentenced to 12 Months of Jail with Huber (Concurrent to 21CF579) and is granted 97 days of sentence credit.
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion on postconviction relief hearing on April 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:51 AM cases 21CF579, 21CF396, 22CF156 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Daniel J. Heyde appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Daniel J. Heyde. In 22CF156: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Parties are close to resolution. A Status Conference (possible plea) is scheduled for 4/8/2022 at 11:00 AM (in person).

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Daniel J. Heyde appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Waives read of the complaint and the time limits for preliminary hearing. Bond is set. There is a Motion hearing already schedule in  21CF579 & 21CF396 in Br. 4 on 02/21/22. 22CF156 will ride along. There is a PTC on all three cases: 02/23/22 at 2:45pm.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services if released.
